text: Well, to me the immediate problem is that it's faulty to view God as a being among other beings.  God is more like being-itself.  Thus by definition you can't really have a God-eating-penguin.  However, this statement is ridiculing the "you can't prove God doesn't exist" argument, which is a bad argument so I don't mind this statement that much.  *Shrugs*
